Issues.Title: Import modules only work in routing modules not default
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
I create lazy loaded components with a module and a routing module to separate routing functionality. I wish to import the Common Module and a custom Material Design module into example-module but it will only accept being imported into example-routing-module.

The following error message is thrown in the console 'Cannot bind to '' as it is not a known property.'

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction
Create a component with an associated module and routing module.

### Reproduction Steps**
Use the Angular CLI to generate a new component and then create a module with the -- routing flag to separate routing functionality. 

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
Expected: Common Module and Material Module should be imported into the main module and not the routing module.
Actual: Application will only load if I import associated import into the associated routing module.

## 🌍  Your Environment
Node v13.2.0
Angular CLI 8.3.20
OS win32 x64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Import modules only work in routing modules not default" (#34297)

Issues.Title: In Ivy, ng-container is preventing content children from being queried
Issues.Body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 bug report

"@angular/core": "9.0.0-rc.5" with Ivy 

### Is this a regression?

Very Likely. 

### Description

Previously, I was able to query content children that were nested inside `ng-container`. For example:

```html
<hello-container>
    <ng-container>
        <hello [name]="'Tom'"></hello>
        <hello [name]="'Jerry'"></hello>
    </ng-container>
</hello-container>
```

```ts
@Component({
  selector: 'hello-container',
  template: `<ng-content></ng-content>`,
})
export class HelloContainerComponent  {
  @ContentChildren(HelloComponent) hellos: QueryList<HelloComponent>;

  ngAfterContentInit() {
    console.log(this.hellos.length);
  }
}
```

This code snippet above would log 2 like here reproduced in Angular 8: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ngfor-ngcontainer-ngif. 

__But in Ivy, it would log 0__ as it's not querying/registering content children if they are nested with `ng-container`.

## How to reproduce

We just need to enable ivy.

Reproduction in Ivy: https://ivy.ng-run.com/edit/83UoqeeHqo08KIenCTIM

## Expected behavior

Should be able to register content children like it does in Angular 8.

## Versions

* Angular: 9.0.0-rc.5

## Additional notes

I tried it with `ngProjectAs` as shown below:

```html
<hello-container>
    <ng-container ngProjectAs="hello">
        <hello [name]="'Tom'"></hello>
        <hello [name]="'Jerry'"></hello>
    </ng-container>
</hello-container>
```
Unfortunately, this didn't help solve the issue either.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "In Ivy, ng-container is preventing content children from being queried" (#34289)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): handle SafeStyles in [style.prop] correctly
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, values wrapped into SafeStyle were not handled correctly in [style.prop] bindings in case style sanitizer is present (when template contains some style props that require sanitization). Style sanitizer was not unwrapping values in case a given prop doesn't require sanitization.As a result, wrapped values were used as final styling values (see [styling/bindings.ts](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/render3/styling/bindings.ts#L620)). This commit updates the logic to unwrap safe values in sanitizer in case no sanitization is required.

This PR closes #34023.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): handle SafeStyles in [style.prop] correctly" (#34286)

Issues.Title: refactor: remove code duplication (detectChangesInternal / renderComponentOrTemplate)
Issues.Body:
While reviewing PR #34241 we had to come up with a less-than-ideal fix (having a check for a destroyed view in `refreshView`, which is super-hot part of the code). My initial reaction was that the said check should be inside `detectChangesInternal` but it turned out not enough. This resulted in discovery of another, duplicated code-path (`renderComponentOrTemplate`).

In the scope of this issue we should:
* [ ] remove the mentioned code duplication
* [ ] see if we can move a check for destroyed views into the new function (result of the above refactoring)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "refactor: remove code duplication (detectChangesInternal / renderComponentOrTemplate)" (#34285)

Issues.Title: Potential improvements to globals API docs
Issues.Body:
#34237 adds initial support for exposing globals (e.g. available at runtime on `window`) in the API docs. Here are some potential future improvements (further discussion needed):

- [ ] No great way to search for all globals (or a specific type of globals, such as global functions).
- [ ] Converting the name from `ng.someFunc` to `ngSomeFunc` in the URL is confusing/misleading.

Discussion: https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/34237#issuecomment-562688760

Issues.Title: ci: run acceptance tests on saucelabs with ivy
Issues.Body:
Currently we only run Saucelabs on PRs using the legacy View Engine build. Switching that build to Ivy is not trivial and there are various options:

1. Updating the R3 switches to use `POST_R3` by default. At first glance, this doesn't look easy because the current ngtsc switch logic seems to be unidirectional (only PRE_R3 to POST_R3).
2. Updating the legacy setup to run with Ivy. This sounds like the easiest solution at first.. but it turns out to be way more complicated.
   * Packages would need to be built with ngtsc using legacy tools (i.e. first building the compiler-cli; and then building packages)
   * View Engine only tests would need to be determined and filtered out. Basically it will result in re-auditing all test targets... Contradictory to the fact that we have this information in Bazel already.
3. Creating a new job that runs tests on Saucelabs with Bazel. We specify fine-grained test targets that should run. This would be a good start (e.g. acceptance tests) and also would mean that we do not continue maintaining the legacy setup..
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "ci: run acceptance tests on saucelabs with ivy" (#34277)

```
yarn bazel run modules/benchmarks/src/styling/ng2:prodserver
```

```
mkdir -p ~/tmp/chrome

```

Issues.Title: Angular complains about missing `index.ts` when it is there
Issues.Body:
When running `ng serve -o` on a project that includes `@fireflysemantics/slice` I get the following error: ``` ERROR in ./node_modules/@fireflysemantics/slice/index.ts Module build failed (from ./node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/index.js): Error: /home/ole/Temp/sph/node_modules/@fireflysemantics/slice/index.ts is missing from the TypeScript compilation. Please make sure it is in your tsconfig via the 'files' or 'include' property. The missing file seems to be part of a third party library. TS files in published libraries are often a sign of a badly packaged library. Please open an issue in the library repository to alert its author and ask them to package the library using the Angular Package Format (https://goo.gl/jB3GVv). at AngularCompilerPlugin.getCompiledFile (/home/ole/Temp/sph/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/angular_compiler_plugin.js:900:23) at /home/ole/Temp/sph/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/loader.js:41:31 at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:85:5) ``` I don't get this error in Stackblitz projects. For example here's one with the most recent version of `@fireflysemantics/slice`: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-slice-ngrx-scratch-demo-final-version9 Do we need do include the `index.ts` manually in the `files` or `include` property? # 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes it has worked in all previous versions. Simple steps to reproduce this bug. ``` ole@mkt:~/Temp$ ng new fstest ? Would you like to add Angular routing? Yes ? Which stylesheet format would you like to use? SCSS [ https://sass-lang.com/documentation/syntax#scss npm i -S @fireflysemantics/slice ``` Create this `app.component.ts`: ``` import { Component } from '@angular/core' import { EStore} from '@fireflysemantics/slice' class Todo {} @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'] }) export class AppComponent { constructor() { const eStore:EStore = new EStore() console.log(eStore) } title = 'fstest'; } ``` Now run `ng serve -o` You should get the error. ## 🔥 Exception or Error

Issues.Title: build: update rollup to version 1.27.9
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [rollup](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup) | dependencies | patch | [`1.27.8` -> `1.27.9`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/rollup/1.27.8/1.27.9) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>rollup/rollup</summary>

### [`v1.27.9`](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​1279)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/compare/v1.27.8...v1.27.9)

_2019-12-07_

##### Bug Fixes

-   Fix an issue where reexports could be missing when preserving modules ([#​3273](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3273))
-   Allow turning of color output via NO_COLOR or FORCE_COLOR=0 environment variables ([#​3272](https://togithub.com/rollup/rollup/issues/3272))

# 🐞 Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [X ] build ### Is this a regression? < !-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? --> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... ### Description My application supports 3 locals: da, sv and en. When using CLI v.8.x it works as expected, creating a folder for each language build in the dist folder (see attached image) When using latest CLI v.9-rc.5 , the build creates double folders, so /dist/da becomes /dist/da/da etc.. Issues.Title: Can't build library importing uuid
Issues.Body:
This is a description of the problem along with the variations attempted:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59221867/angular-build-results-in-error-cannot-call-a-namespace-v1

This is the repository containing the code:
https://github.com/fireflysemantics/slice/tree/angular-package-format/angular-package-format-workspace

The library is `projects/slice` .  If I try this import:

```
import * as v1 from "uuid/v1";
```

The tests run but Angular will not build the package.  The error logged is:

> Error: Cannot call a namespace ('v1')
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't build library importing uuid" (#16378)

Issues.Title: Resolve typescript paths when compiling libraries
Issues.Body:
If we setup the typescript `paths` option for libraries the libraries get compiled without resolving the paths.  For example if we declared a path like this:

```
      "@app/*": ["projects/my-lib/src/lib/*"] 

```

And build.  The compiled fesm2015 will look like this:

```
import { Test } from '@app/test';

```
I have been using typescript transform paths for this in the past, but I was hoping Angular Library support would have it baked in.  

https://www.npmjs.com/package/typescript-transform-paths
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Resolve typescript paths when compiling libraries" (#16383)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): handle aliased or existing environment import
Issues.Body:
Closes: #16226

I debugged a little bit that issue. The exception `Cannot read property 'length' of undefined` wasn't really informative thus I had to find out where this exception was actually thrown. All ways led me to the `Chunk` class and the `insertLeft` method that used `buffer`'s variable `length` property. The `buffer` was `undefined`, that's why that exception was thrown. It was `undefined` because there is no way to check if `environment` is already imported.

This PR adds the ability to handle the already existing "environment" import or the named one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): handle aliased or existing environment import" (#16377)

Issues.Title: The command ng serve is not responding to changes to ng module
Issues.Body:
# 🐞 Bug report

### Command

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Description

`ng serve` either is not responding to changes made to the `declarations` property of an `NgModule`.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction
1. `ng new pokemon --routing=false --style=css`
2. `ng generate component pokedex`
3. set up `pokedex` to be used by the root component
4. `ng serve`
5. remove `pokedex` from the `declarations` field of the `NgModule` in `app.module.ts`

### Expected
The app crashes
### Actual
The app continues working

### Additional Information
Restarting `ng serve` fixes the issue.
This also works vice-versa, so if the application is crashing due to `pokedex` _not_ being in the `declarations` of `app.module.ts`, adding it without restarting `ng serve` will still be crashing.

## 🌍 Your Environment
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25158423/70344220-fe669a80-180d-11ea-87ef-afb74aacd87a.png)

## Demo
I've created a demo project [here](https://github.com/wagnermaciel/Pokedex).
To reproduce this issue
1. `git clone https://github.com/wagnermaciel/Pokedex.git`
2. `npm install`
3. `ng serve`
4. Go to http://localhost:4200/pikachu
4. remove `PokedexComponent` from the `declarations` of the `NgModule` in `src/app.app.module.ts`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The command ng serve is not responding to changes to ng module" (#16376)

Issues.Title: datepicker memory leak
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. go to https://material.angular.io/components/datepicker/examples
2. open datepicker and close multiple times
3. each open and close action generate **135KB** memory leak.

The more times we open and close datepicker, the more memory are allocated.  
Garbage collector does not clear all allocated memory.

![](https://i.imgur.com/5BQgg95.jpg)


 
 
#### Expected Behavior
datepicker without memory leaks

#### Actual Behavior
memory leaks

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14, 9.0.0-rc.5
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3, 9.0.0-rc.5
- Browser(s): Chrome 78.0.3904.108
- Operating System: Fedora 31

Issues.Title: YouTube player component triggers change detection every 250ms
Issues.Body:
#### Bug:

Currently, the YouTube player component triggers change detection every 250ms.
When a `YT.Player` instance is created, `setInterval` is called in it.

#### What is the expected behavior?

The YouTube player component should trigger change detection only by events.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-xnpnny?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
@angular/youtube-player 8.2.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "YouTube player component triggers change detection every 250ms" (#17882)

Issues.Title: fix(youtube-player): avoid setInterval change detection when player is created
Issues.Body: When we create a `Player` object for the `youtube-player` component, the YouTube API kicks off a 250ms `setInterval` which will trigger change detection even if the video is passive on the page. These change run the initialization code outside the `NgZone` so that doesn't happen.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(youtube-player): avoid setInterval change detection when player is created" (#17894)

Issues.Title: DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed before Dialog close animation completes or starts
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When a Dialog is closed before the close animation completes the overlay container is not destroyed. This is similar to https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16284 which resulted in a PR https://github.com/angular/components/pull/16309.

But this PR doesn't fix the edge case where the animation never even starts before it is destroyed. It assumes the animation has to at least start which is where the setTimeout was added. The solution most likely needs to create the timeout inside the close() function but not inside the animation observable.

Specifically I see the close function start, end and then the page fully destroys before the animation observable even gets a change to start (never makes it to the .subscribe segment of `this._containerInstance.animationStateChanged`. 

#### What is the expected behavior?

I would expect that when the close() function is called that the timeout is set immediately (not in an observable) as a fallback in case any part of the animation close observable (even it's start) doesn't occur which will still call `this._overlayRef.dispose()`.

#### What is the current behavior?

Current behavior is the overlay DOM elements are still present after a path change while a modal is still open.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?

This is still a good place to reproduce this: https://stackblitz.com/github/mike88ua/redirect_from_dialog
Simple steps are open a dialog and generate a path change while the dialog is still open that is a local Angular path change to some place in the same angular app. The Overlay DOM elements are still present.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?

Avoid overlay fragments being left on the page.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

* Angular: 7.3.x 
* Material: 7.3.x
* Browser: Chrome

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I will test a version of this change and provide a PR if it works correctly.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DOM nodes not cleaned up if view container is destroyed before Dialog close animation completes or starts" (#17891)

Issues.Title: MatTab: selectedTabChange should not fire when the tab is changed programmatically
Issues.Body:
There should be a way to differentiate **between a UI and a programmaticcally induced tab change**. As of now, both cause the selectedTabChange: EventEmitter<MatTabChangeEvent> to emit.

My case is pretty simple: I want to display the currently opened Tab in the URL:

somePage?openedTab=1
somePage?openedTab=2

But I also want the corresponding tab to open when a URL pointing to a specific tab is navigated to. **Ideally, the [selectedIndex] input should not cause (selectedTabChange) to fire**.

Does this make sense?

Material 8.2.3, Angular 8.2.11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatTab: selectedTabChange should not fire when the tab is changed programmatically" (#17889)

Issues.Title: error to run simple app on firefox
Issues.Body:
I am trying to run a very simple app made with angular 8 using [material angular](https://material.angular.io/)  on firefox 33.0.1

This is what I have done:

I changed tsConfig.json to

I added the following polyfills

`Firefox >= 22`

But when I open the application in firefox 33 I receive the following error

Issues.Title: Focus issue for radio group as first element in dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

I've recreated the issue here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-2nkqr3-znajkf

Steps to reproduce:
1. For the dialog opened by button 2, then select a radio option (say 'Badger')
2. Tab through the elements to get to the Ok button.
3. Press Tab
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The focus in the radio group should be on the selected option.

#### Actual Behavior

The focus in the radio group is on the first option (whether it is selected or not)


#### Environment

Have tried this in both Firefox and Chrome

#### Notes

For the dialog by button 3 I have put an input control before the radio group in the tab order in the dialog, and this behaves as would be expected (tab takes you to the selected option).

I did ask about this in stackoverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59024581/radio-button-focus-in-angular-material-dialog (although I've only just put the correct tag on it), but I think its not something to be worked around with tab order.

Thanks,

Matt
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Focus issue for radio group as first element in dialog" (#17876)

Issues.Title: Mat-icon Doc Should Add HttpClient Dependency Notice
Issues.Body:
#### Mat-icon Doc  Should Add  HttpClient Dependency Notice

There's a Dependency Missing Error when I tried to use Custom SVG icon in the mat-icon component. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48773605/70126458-09a5b300-16b4-11ea-86f3-73909793f41c.png)

It's really not a big deal that, given the fact that I have played around with Angular for a while now, but I don't think this is beginner friendly, and honestly, it's quite confusing. 

So, a further explanation or warning or simply a notice to user that this component have other dependencies, the HttpClientModule, would be brilliant, I think. such as "Before using your custom SVG icons, please make sure that you have include a HttpClientModule in your pertinent module"

**Affected documentation page:** [Icon Overview](https://material.angular.io/components/icon/overview)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-icon Doc Should Add HttpClient Dependency Notice" (#17870)

Issues.Title: Drag And Drop Angular Material Table on first drop
Issues.Body:

I have a mat-table in a div container that is only created when table datasource is not empty with an ngIf. So when datasource is not empty and I try to drag and drop a row, first time I receive currentposition with -1 value on drop event. So first time no drag and drop is made. The following time the behavior is normal. Moreover, I realised that If table is shown and I click on a button with no functionality the drag and drop is made right on first time.

You could find more details on:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59127462/angular-material-mattable-drag-and-drop
